subject: Travel
title: How National Parks Were Invented
description: Learn How National Parks Were Invented in one minute.

hook.text: In 1872, the United States created Yellowstone â€” the world's first national park. The idea was radical.

buildup.text: Before this, wild land was something to be tamed, logged, or mined. Preserving it seemed wasteful.

discovery.text: Artist Thomas Moran's paintings of Yellowstone convinced Congress the land was too beautiful to sell.

twist.text: The park displaced Native Americans who had lived there for 11,000 years. Their removal was part of the plan.

climax.text: Today over 100 countries have national park systems, all inspired by the Yellowstone model.

punchline.text: America's best idea started with a painting and a painful cost.

quiz.question: What was the world's first national park?
